meanings.definition: Relating to the universe as a whole.
meanings.sent1: The stars in the sky looked cosmically beautiful.
meanings.sent2: She gazed up at the cosmically vast night sky.
meanings.sent3: The alien's spaceship had a cosmically advanced design.
meanings.sent4: The idea of parallel universes is cosmically mind-boggling.
meanings.sent5: The galaxy's rotation was cosmically mesmerizing.

meanings.definition: In a manner that pertains to the cosmos.
meanings.sent1: The astronaut traveled cosmically through space.
meanings.sent2: The telescope allowed them to observe the stars cosmically.
meanings.sent3: The comet streaked across the sky cosmically fast.
meanings.sent4: The planets aligned cosmically in a rare celestial event.
meanings.sent5: The satellite transmitted data cosmically efficiently.

meanings.definition: To an extent that is vast and beyond human comprehension.
meanings.sent1: The universe expands cosmically every moment.
meanings.sent2: The galaxies collide and merge cosmically over eons.
meanings.sent3: The idea of infinity stretches cosmically in our minds.
meanings.sent4: The cosmic forces interact cosmically in the void.
meanings.sent5: The stars twinkle cosmically in the dark expanse.
